channel.title: [pi] source
channel.description: I need to know where the skillxp is and what to search to change it. Thanks and also this is off topic but if anyone knows a good webclient tut for [pi] could u just leave the link thanks again.

item.title: [pi] source
item.dc:creator: @grats grats
item.description:
@grats wrote:

[quote=“rash, post:7, topic:374962”][quote author=David The Drummer link=topic=470929.msg3443881#msg3443881 date=1293257934]

Sorry i should had been more clarifyed i am trying to change the skill xp.

What skill…
[/quote]

your so stupid.

In PI all skill xp is located in the config.java file.

for noncombat skills you should see this at the bottom of your config class:

[code]

/**
* Skill Experience Multipliers
*/	
public static final int WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int MINING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int SMITHING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FARMING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FIREMAKING_EXPERIENCE = 20;
public static final int HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FISHING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int AGILITY_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int PRAYER_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int RUNECRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int CRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int THIEVING_EXPERIENCE = 80;
public static final int SLAYER_EXPERIENCE = 5;
public static final int COOKING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FLETCHING_EXPERIENCE = 10;[/code]

for combat exp you should see this:

public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = 100; // damage * exp rate public static final int RANGE_EXP_RATE = 100; public static final int MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 80; public static final double SERVER_EXP_BONUS = 1;

underneath this:

public static final boolean itemRequirements = true;[/quote]

ok u dont got to make fun of me cuz im not to pi so gfto of my thread is you going to be rude i asked for help not negitivity.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] source
item.dc:creator: @dgk_all_day1 dgk_all_day
item.description:
@dgk_all_day1 wrote:

[quote=“David The Drummer, post:2, topic:374962”][quote author=grats link=topic=470929.msg3443868#msg3443868 date=1293257517]
I need to know where the skillxp is and what to search to change it. Thanks and also this is off topic but if anyone knows a good webclient tut for [pi] could u just leave the link thanks again.
[/quote]
Well you’re not leaving us with much here. src<server<model<players<skills is what I’m assuming you’re asking for[/quote]

ima laugh at you

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] source
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“David The Drummer, post:4, topic:374962”][quote author=grats link=topic=470929.msg3443878#msg3443878 date=1293257876]
Sorry i should had been more clarifyed i am trying to change the skill xp.
[/quote]
What skill…[/quote]

your so stupid.

In PI all skill xp is located in the config.java file.

for noncombat skills you should see this at the bottom of your config class:

[code]

/**
* Skill Experience Multipliers
*/	
public static final int WOODCUTTING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int MINING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int SMITHING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FARMING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FIREMAKING_EXPERIENCE = 20;
public static final int HERBLORE_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FISHING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int AGILITY_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int PRAYER_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int RUNECRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int CRAFTING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int THIEVING_EXPERIENCE = 80;
public static final int SLAYER_EXPERIENCE = 5;
public static final int COOKING_EXPERIENCE = 10;
public static final int FLETCHING_EXPERIENCE = 10;[/code]

for combat exp you should see this:

public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = 100; // damage * exp rate public static final int RANGE_EXP_RATE = 100; public static final int MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 80; public static final double SERVER_EXP_BONUS = 1;

underneath this:

public static final boolean itemRequirements = true;
